column1: Appendix table 18.  Number of facilities under state or federal authority that provided educational programs to inmates, December 30, 2005
Report title: Census of State and Federal Correctional Facilities, 2005 NCJ 222182
Data source: Census of State and Federal Correctional Facilities, 2005
Appendix table 18.  Number of facilities under state or federal authority that provided educational programs to inmates, December 30, 2005
Note:  Information on education programs was not reported in 42 state facilities.
a/Includes literacy training and first- to fourth-grade level education.
b/Includes fifth- to eighth-grade level education.
d/Includes programs for inmates with learning disabilities.
e/Includes facilities operated by both federal and state authorities.
g/The total number of facilities are as of June 30.

h/As of December 30, 2001, sentenced felons from the District of Columbia were the reponsibility of the Federal Bureau of Prisons. Some inmates were housed in private facilities under contract to the District of Columbia on December 30, 2005.
